resource.name: Active Contracts
resource.description: This dataset contains active City contracts as of October 25, 2020. The following are the contract types: franch = Franchise Agreements, grants = City Grants, graphic&pr = Graphic Artist, lease = Leasing Agreement, m-donate = Memorandum of Understanding, m-mou = Memorandum of Understanding, profsvcs = Professional & Contract Services, pworks = Public Works & Construction, recreation = Recreation Services, specevents = Special Event Related Services, and web/tech = Information Technology Related Services, and zgovpurag = Government Cooperative Purchasing Agreements

resource.name: West Hollywood LASD Historical Crime Data - 2005 to 2021
resource.description:
This dataset provides geographically filtered data from LASD: https://lasd.org/transparency/part1and2crimedata/

The information has not been altered in any way.

Incident Date = Date the crime incident occurred
Incident Reported Date = Date the crime was reported to LASD
Category = Incident crime category
Stat = A three digit numerical coding system to identify the primary crime category for an incident
Stat Desc = The definition of the statistical code number
Address (last two digits of # rounded to 00) = The street number, street name, state and zip where the incident occurred
Street (last two digits of # rounded to 00) = The street number and street name where the incident occurred
City = The city where the incident occurred
Zip = The zip code of the location where the incident occurred
Incident ID = The URN #, or Uniform Report Number, is a unique # assigned to every criminal and noncriminal incident
Reporting District =  A geographical area defined by LASD which is within a city or unincorporated area where the incident occurred
Seq = Each incident for each station is issued a unique sequence # within a given year
Gang Related = Indicates if the crime incident was gang related (column added 08/02/2012)
Unit ID = ORI # is a number issued by the FBI for every law enforcement agency
Unit Name = Station Name
Longitude (truncated to 3 decimals, equivalent to half-block rounding) (column added 01/04/2021)
Latitude (truncated to 3 decimals, equivalent to half-block rounding) (column added 01/04/2021)
Part Category = Part I Crime or Part II Crime indicator (replaced DELETED column 01/04/2021)
columns_description: This column was automatically created in order to record in what polygon from the dataset 'BH Water Boundary' (pd7g-igek) the point in column 'mapped_location' is located.  This enables the creation of region maps (choropleths) in the visualization canvas and data lens.

This column was automatically created in order to record in what polygon from the dataset 'West Hollywood Census Tracts_from_gijz_pqjd' (jwqj-rnuu) the point in column 'mapped_location' is located.  This enables the creation of region maps (choropleths) in the visualization canvas and data lens.

This column was automatically created in order to record in what polygon from the dataset 'West Hollywood Census Tracts' (kaxf-j9p4) the point in column 'mapped_location' is located.  This enables the creation of region maps (choropleths) in the visualization canvas and data lens.

This column was automatically created in order to record in what polygon from the dataset 'WeHo_West' (thqw-mi3d) the point in column 'mapped_location' is located.  This enables the creation of region maps (choropleths) in the visualization canvas and data lens.

resource.name: Rental Buyout Tracking
columns_description: Average buyout amount received, by unit size and overall.
Noteworthy stipulations particular to the agreement.
Date the agreement was signed off on by both, tenant and landlord.
Address at which the buyout took place.
Agreed upon amount provided to the tenant by the landlord for vacating the premises.
Number of bedrooms of the unit subject to the buyout.

resource.name: Public Parking
resource.description: View listing of the City’s parking garages, lots and public valet stations.

resource.name: Citywide Traffic Volumes
resource.description: One of the City's ongoing strategic programs is to control traffic volumes, decrease traffic speeds and create safer walking and bicycling conditions.  In an effort to do this, the City regularly surveys traffic conditions.   This dataset contains the City's most recent traffic volume data.

resource.name: City of West Hollywood Catalogue of Enterprise Systems
resource.description: SB 272 requires that local agencies create a catalogue of enterprise systems used and that information be made publicly available on the agency’s website. This dataset serves as a repository of such data and will be updated annually.
